pullRequest.body:
The motivation is that it is additivisable (even though it currently isn't) and is used in group theory files.


---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

The import increase in this PR should be completely cancelled by the follow-up PR #22121

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21028~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

To me, the main issue feels like the import of `GroupTheory.Perm` into `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.End`: it "goes against the grain" of importing `Algebra` in `GroupTheory` but not the other way around. If we change the direction or split this somehow, do things start to look better?

I am not so sure: `Perm Î±` is the group of automorphisms of `Î±`, and `Algebra.Group.Action.End` is supposed to be about the monoid of endomorphisms and group of automorphisms, so the import seems natural. If anything, I think `GroupTheory.Perm.Basic` could be moved under `Algebra`. Also note that it was previously imported in `Algebra.Group.Action.Basic`, which I agree was wrong (and definitely wronger than I have here).

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I assume you checked that `@[simps]` generates the same lemma as the previous `MulDistribMulAction.toMonoidHom_apply`?
This seems to be the only source of import bumps, I think it's fine either way if we keep this import or remove it.

pullRequest.title: chore: move `MulDistribMulAction` under `Algebra.Group`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Group/Action): group similar lemmas

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21028~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

To me, the main issue feels like the import of `GroupTheory.Perm` into `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.End`: it "goes against the grain" of importing `Algebra` in `GroupTheory` but not the other way around. If we change the direction or split this somehow, do things start to look better?

I am not so sure: `Perm Î±` is the group of automorphisms of `Î±`, and `Algebra.Group.Action.End` is supposed to be about the monoid of endomorphisms and group of automorphisms, so the import seems natural. If anything, I think `GroupTheory.Perm.Basic` could be moved under `Algebra`. Also note that it was previously imported in `Algebra.Group.Action.Basic`, which I agree was wrong (and definitely wronger than I have here).

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
